availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, railroad dealer and conductor. Pennsylvania native. Married to Lou Petry on May 20, 1868. Father of Jesse Petry, Amelia Petry, and Alice Petry. Mustered into service as a drummerboy in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) on December 14, 1861. Became a Private in 1862. Promoted to Sergeant Major in 1864. Railroad dealer in Shelby County in 1870. Railroad conductor in Shelby County in 1880.

ab.bibl: Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, p. 400. Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, p. 335. Kentucky County Marriage Records 1783-1965, Shelby County, no. 3459 .Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 894. Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 285.
